main_definition: The process of producing text or images, typically with ink on paper using a printing press or modern digital methods.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of pressing an object into the surface to create an impression
meanings_and_examples.example: When she pressed her hand onto the clay, it left an imprint.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make a copy or replica of something by transferring its image onto another medium
meanings_and_examples.example: The artist printed his painting on canvas to create several copies for sale.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of software used to digitally reproduce text and images, typically in preparation for printing
meanings_and_examples.example: She used a design program like Adobe Illustrator to prepare her artwork for print.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process of converting digital files into physical copies using printers or other devices
meanings_and_examples.example: After editing his photos, he printed them on high-quality photo paper.
